text: hi and thanks for joining us for this
year's grpc conf
a little bit different than the
welcoming we were hoping to have
within beautiful austin texas but that's
all right
one advantage of having a virtual event
is that we can
share all of our amazing stuff with
people across the world
folks who would normally be able to
attend in person are now able to attend
and
share with us the things they're working
on meet others and
and learn from everyone so this is a
really really nice alternative
hopefully next year we'll be able to all
be together in person
at this event and many others i want to
again
thank you all for attending and for
sending your
submission ideas and just being part of
the grpc community
also i have to give a big big thanks to
our sponsors for this event
the cloud native computing foundation
and google cloud
both are the diamond sponsors and
without them we would not be able to do
this event
i also would like to give another thanks
to the cloud native computing foundation
for doing an underwriting of a
tech writer that we have working on grpc
documentation
this is something that we've been
hearing from a lot of you
for quite a while that we needed to kind
of give the whole documentation site an
overhaul
improve some things and make it more
user-friendly so we're very excited
that we have this underway right now you
no doubt have seen
patrice commenting on github issues
and being involved in the website repo
we're very excited that he's able to
help us and
huge thanks to cncf for supplying the
tech writer to the project we're very
very grateful it's been a big year um
not only did we you know
finally get to undertake our big
documentation updates but we've also had
some pretty big releases we had
the net core release with grpc
a big thanks to the microsoft team for
that very exciting to see that
grpc kotlin also was recently announced
and you'll
hear more about that tomorrow from james
ward
and we also had the grpc js 1.0
re-implementation and typescript
so there's been a lot that's gone on uh
just in this past year since we saw
everyone in sunnyvale and we're really
excited about what's coming in the
future
i think you will hear some of the
exciting things
that folks are working on during today
and tomorrow for the conference
and we hope that we'll be able to share
more of these stories with you
as we redo our community meetings and
everything else to
you know fit our new virtual landscape
with the world so
keep an eye out for information on that
as well
later today you'll have the opportunity
to chat with some of the grpc
maintainers as well as myself if you've
got questions about how to get
involved with the community and how to
engage
more with the different projects and
repositories that
grpc has please do join us for that
session if you have a specific language
that you're looking for assistance with
if we don't have that particular
maintainer we will get them
so please do bring your questions and if
you're unable to make that time today
we will have people throughout the
conference available
at the booths and able to have
conversations with you and then of
course we have
are the usual suspects of the mailing
list
and the getter chats and i believe
there's still some active stuff
on irc as well so definitely do join us
and bring your questions we would love
to
chat with you more and hear about the
cool stuff that you're building with
grpc
so again thank you very much for being
here this year we're very
excited to have the second event and
to be able to have this avenue to share
some of the cool things that everyone is
working on and building
and we look forward to hopefully you'll
be able to join us next year and you'll
be speaking and
sharing some of the amazing things that
you've done thank you very much
and enjoy today and tomorrow and enjoy
meeting other folks that are working
with the project and
checking out how you can get involved
thanks
